event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected resource, the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u <EVENT_ID>.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of level 2 cache control errors has exceeded acceptable levels.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Message ID:   %MSGID% indicates that processor L2 cache is faulty. There will have been a system reset. The nature of the fault does not allow an automated attempt to disable the affected resource. It is recommended that the system administrator contact Sun support and arrange for the replacement of the affected component.

Use the command  fmdump -v -u <EVENT_ID>  with the  <EVENT_ID>  from the console message to locate the faulty component. For this fault, the fault manager may identify a single thread or all threads on the processor as faulty as shown in the examples below. Note that in both examples, the faulty FRU called out is the same. In these examples, the FRU is the motherboard. Also note the FRU part number and location is included in the output of fmdump: 

part=501781301

Location: MB

This is the example fmdump output where a single thread is designated faulty. 

# fmdump -v -u acc4f6d3-c4ef-ec7d-ba45-ef77c524085f
TIME                 UUID                                 SUNW-MSG-ID
Oct 02 12:23:39.4765 acc4f6d3-c4ef-ec7d-ba45-ef77c524085f %MSGID%
  100%  fault.cpu.ultraSPARC-T2plus.l2cachectl

        Problem in: cpu:///cpuid=0/serial=FAC006B0E654482
           Affects: cpu:///cpuid=0/serial=FAC006B0E654482
               FRU: hc://:serial=110508:part=501781301/motherboard=0
          Location: MB

This is the example fmdump output where all threads are designated faulty. 

# fmdump -v -u 73cc6480-5d9d-e213-c286-da0d9353b95c
TIME                 UUID                                 SUNW-MSG-ID
Sep 26 12:33:29.0011 73cc6480-5d9d-e213-c286-da0d9353b95c %MSGID%
  100%  fault.cpu.ultraSPARC-T2plus.l2cachectl

        Problem in: cpu:///cpuid=63/serial=FAC006B0E654482
           Affects: cpu:///cpuid=63/serial=FAC006B0E654482
               FRU: hc://:serial=110508:part=501781301/motherboard=0
          Location: MB

  100%  fault.cpu.ultraSPARC-T2plus.l2cachectl

        Problem in: cpu:///cpuid=62/serial=FAC006B0E654482
           Affects: cpu:///cpuid=62/serial=FAC006B0E654482
               FRU: hc://:serial=110508:part=501781301/motherboard=0
          Location: MB

                    .
                    .
                    .

  100%  fault.cpu.ultraSPARC-T2plus.l2cachectl

        Problem in: cpu:///cpuid=0/serial=FAC006B0E654482
           Affects: cpu:///cpuid=0/serial=FAC006B0E654482
               FRU: hc://:serial=110508:part=501781301/motherboard=0
          Location: MB
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: System performance is likely to be affected. System may be unstable.
event_registry_properties.name: response
title
event_registry_properties.item: Level 2 cache control errors exceeded acceptable levels
